values: Traudy, omg the big ugly green woodman sign is gone! now it might have been gone for a while and i didn't notice but wowa, thats not fair it was like the ugly bayne of the existence of everyone who went there. very odd

my mother is a frosty bitch and dealing with her is becomming increasingly difficult. i realized today the ability my mother has to sevierly bring down my mood, it's like i talk to her and i become grumpy and unhappy. i think i need to stop dealing with her and it will be easier. i just don't even want to try anymore, i'll try to make conversation with her by asking how her day was or how her classes are going or whatever and she gives me one word (or very short closed ended) responces and then often procedes to leave the room , which really just makes me feel worse. whats the point? i'm getting sick of trying to be nice to her when it's just bringing me down, she's like a black rain cloud. 

but she's my mom, how can i really justify not talking to her?

ps. telus motem being gay as a result my wireless has been disconnected and i don't have internet in my room for the time being, so i won't be as accessable as usual.

raye: way to call me back after i called you back about your aparent wanting to chat it up...you make me curious and suspicious.

yesterday i saw the most canadian event i think i've ever experienced. a man having breakfast at tim hortons was sorting and counting his canadian tire money while looking through the canadian tire flyer. it made me smile.

i've been filling my life with meaningless shit. 

now what do i do when nothing in my life means anything?

too many movies and talking to vicky about her love life makes amy feel philisophical

everyone has insecurities about themselves, they look and see that they are not "ideal girl" or "ideal boy" but realisticly who looks for thoes people? they don't exisist anyways. so everyone lives with their not enough this or that and too much this or that, and thinks that they could never be loved because of their this or thats, and that no one would find them apealing. but then allong comes someone who finds your not enough this or that and too much this or that to be just right this and that. and if our lucky, their not enough this or that and too much this or that, is just right this or that. 

don't comment if you are going to say anything about my emotional state, or the possible future state of my love life, or the past state of my love life.

after almost 4 weeks of singledom i have found a song that represents my sentaments, and who knew, it was there all along, a song that i've known since grade 4 or 5. Love fool by the cardigans. 
Dear, I fear we're facing a problem
You love me no longer, I know
And maybe there is nothing
that I can do to make you do
Mama tells me I shouldn't bother
That I ought just stick to another man
A man that surely deserves me
But I think you do

So I cry, I pray, and I beg
Love me, love me
Say that you love me
Fool, fool me
Go on and fool me
Love me, love me
Pretend that you love me
Leave me, leave me
Just say that you need me
So I cry, and I beg for you to
Love me, love me
Say that you love me
Leave me, leave me
Just say that you need me
I can't care about anything but you


Lately I have desperately pondered
Spent my nights awake an I wonder
What I could have done in another way
To make you stay
Reason will not lead to solution
I will end up lost in confusion
I don't care if you really care
As long as you don't go

It's perfection as a set of lyrics for my life, it describes my sentaments etc etc. while type this i'm watching High fedelity, and feeling sappy, as  think this is representative of my life at the moment as well, i pity the fool who reads this actually. but this movie is, amazing, fantastic, and perfect. that is all for now.

that is all.

so, talking to my mom tonight when she gets home. tell her that the sewing show is comming up soon, she responds with "i know" and i go oh, well i was thinking i would go on the friday so if you wanted maybe we could go together, she says "i'm already going". then i say so you knew about it and you didn't tell me, and she shrugs. so i ask her what day she was going to go and she said both, so then i say oh well there is a thing online that has all the worshop times and what not if you want to know about them. she walks to her room and gets a brochure that she has on it that she got from god knows where, and says "did you want to look at them?" i'm like no i've already seen it. and even after me talking to her about it, she still doesn't go oh yeah it would be fun to go together. 

ok WHAT THE FUCK WAS SHE THINKING? i only work in the FUCKING FABRIC INDUSTRY you think i would want to go, and if i wasn't talking about it you think oh maybe she doesn't know maybe i could tell her. or oh we mother daughter sew it would be fun to go together, fuck what the hell! honestly had i not see a poster today i would have never know about it till like the last day of it when she came home and went "man i sure had fun at the sewing show today" and i would have missed out. 

more proof that my mom is a psycotic bitch!

ever notice that all the adds for hot new condos in calgary have people in beds? its couples laying in bed or single hot people (usually women) laying in beds, or one i saw was a hot young single woman laying on a sofa. i think it's rather odd that the one thing we know about the condo that we should have be the spark that makes us look into buying one is that people lay arround in them. i'm sure there is some sort of sofisticated marketing here but it illudes me. why not people cooking, or eating dinner with wine, or reading? thats hip and urban...well whatever.

exerps from my book that i think are far too poetic in a awcword nerdy kind of way to not be shared:

"do you remember that olf TV series, get smart? you remember at the beginning where maxwell smart is walking down the secret coridor and there are all of thoes doors that open sideways, and upsidedown and gateways and stuff? i think that everybody keeps a whole bunch of doors just like this between themselves and the world. But when you fall in love, all of your doors are open, and all of their doors are open. And uou rollerskate down your halls together.

Karla and i fell in love somewhere out there--i think thats the way is happens out there. The two of you start talking about your feelings and your feelings float outside you likr vapors. and they mix together like a fog. Before you realize it, the two of you have become the same mist and you realize you can nevr return to being just a lone cloud again, because the isolation would be intolerable."

somehow i was reading this and thought that it was one of the best things i had ever read about love. Mike and i have been together 6 months now, if this is the world that eastern religions say it is i must have been pretty fab in my last life to deserve him. i'm going to go off and smile till my face falls off now.
hoem earlier than expected, mike and i are still both alive and we still want to be with eachother, it's amazing. camping is super fun. that is all.

what can i do but complain here..thats how it goes it seems. i, like most people i talk to these days, i am fed up with my job, don't want to go anymore, want a change, want school to start again, want to be independantly wealthy, hehehe. oh well, a couple more days and i'm in the clear. also i'm alost done the in-class portion of drivers ed i have the last session and test tomorow then all i have to do is the incar stuff and i'm set. 

i'm all excited about going camping (a ton) in the next couple of weeks, this weekend we are going for 3 days ou in the bush and then for 8 or so days next month. should be fun, i'm really looking forward to getting out of town, away from work and my parents and juat having fun and relaxing.

i've been thinking this might be the key to happyness at this age, like we can't be independent as much as we whould all like but we can save and get away for a week or two, thats what adds the spice to this time in our lives and makes us interesting people. everyone agree? fab.

so, to show off my mad nerdy poli-sci skills i'm going to propose to you a thought about a classic fairy tale.

so, during the cold war years the US government took to black balling people and things that were socialist/communist. but then we have the classic fairy tale of robinhood. now tell me, is stealing from the rich and giving to the poor and trying to overthrow the oppressive rulers not a clearly socialist plot? i think it is. yet americans tell this story to their children AND our favorite american animater disney made a cartoon out of it. i think this is odd.

in short americans are idiots because they can't keep their ideologies straight.
(when you are working in customer service you have to think abotu things like this to keep you from devolving)

I might be buying a note book computer this week. i've decided this is good and bad, good because i want one for school and then it too will be one less thing i have to buy when i liberate myself. but bad as it will be adding to my ever increasing debt, fuck.

in a sad attempt to keep myself concous i will tell you about my day so far. so i was suposed to get up around 6:30 so that i could eat and get ready for school, but smartly not having set my alarm i was woken up by my mother arround the regular time i get up (7:05) at which point i realized "oh shit i have to be out of the house in 20 min" but some sort of amazing feat insued and i got out of my house in 20 min with all my books, walet and pants. then i come to school for what??? a lab for my intro to computers class, this has got to be the stupidist thing i've ever done, 8:30 is way to early in the morning for trivial bullshit that i culd do with my hands tied behind my back. someone remind me why i'm doing this then i'm feeling a little more rational.

i think i have descovered perhaps the most imediate cause and effect cunundrum in my life. at this moment i'm already feeling the impending doom of my stomach looming for the reason of my lack of will. this will be (i'm willing to bet) the second time this week that i make my self sick (well uncomfortable at least) because i ate food that i know i shouldn't (due to the damaging effect it has on my health and weight) but i ended up loosing a battle of wits with myself and gave into said food(s). so not only does this have long term effects on my helth and goals but in the short term i eat way too much of this food (it's not my fault thay give you so damn much) and i eat it too fast (it smells way too good) and then straight away i feel sick and a couple of hours down the road i feel even worse, and in the earlier case of this week the whole next day i feel sick and think i have the flu. now, i'm beating myself up right now kuz i know i'm going to feel like crap later, but really if you think about it, this is 2 out of 21(or so) meals this week and i usually don't even go that bad in a week; perhaps it's because i have been tending to eat healthy the last couple of months that my body is trying to punish me for poisining it (it should remember the old days when i didn't care about this health crap)

on another note i'm looking into getting myself a notebook computer due to my mom being stupid....in addition to this though i'm looking into getting wireless internet so as to be able to take my computer everywhere, trubble is i'm having a hard time finding out about it. i guess one day i'll just get off my ass and go ask someone at a comp store but if anyone know anything about say providers and or hardware requirements i would love to hear about it.
i hate when i feel like i'm melting into a big sad stupid pile of girl goo.

what i want to know is: how the book store at school can know all about the book that is required for your class, and that you can order it online, but they don't know how much it is?! seriously my semester starts in 19 days and i don't know how much one of my books is. this is irritating, secondly if they do't know how much it is, they obviously don't have it in yet, come on, i need to get my books so i can start classes, i don't like waiting in line for an hour the first day of classes to get my books i want to get them now. the MRC bookstore people will pay!!!!

done book 3, moving onto so long and thanks for all the fish 160 pages and counting so don't get too far ahead of me, i should be done that book, hum well begining of next week at the latest, then it's onto mostly harmless, and i have more time to read now, due to me being done all my school crap (well exams, but thats like 2 weeks from now, pff)

ok so i neen everyone's opinion, what do you think is better?

option one: having only one class on monday and friday, that is one hour long, from 1-1:50, keep in mind that it's going to take me an hour plus travling time in each direction

option two: having mondya and friday off but then my tuesday would be 4 lectures straight from 9:30-3:30 and thursday would be from 9:30 till 4:30 straight

in both cases my wednesday is not too buisy, but there isn't anything i can do about that.

pros of #1, the class looks really cool and it's the same prof i have now so i know he's good, but i will be spending about twice as much time on transit than in class, and it's the middle of the day

pros of #2, i'll have a 4 day weekend, and i can then work an 8 hour shift on monday and friday, this way i'll get more hours (prolly about 24-28/week) and i could always use the money, but it means i will have 6/7 hours of straight lecture which would be hardcore (it would be 1.5 hours of logic, then history, then political theory then eastern religion (my poor head!))

so i'm having a tough time trying to decide on this, and my mother isn't making it any easer, she thinks 4 isn't bad and she thinks i dont' really want to be at school as it is, so when i'm trying to pro and con it with her she goes "well why don't you just take 3 classes and make it really easy on yourself" bitch, grumble. so i'm looking for as much advice as i can get, i'm kinda leaning towards option 2 just kuz then i can work more, but i'm afraid then i won't be on the ball when it gets to the end of the day (and thats religion! the most fun looking one of them all) and if i'm ever sick then i would have to miss all my classes....so yeah, i need input, and fast people!

note: already one on the side of option 2

alright, regarding my comment, i may ahve gotten a bit carried away in the heat of the moment with the latter 2 comments, but thats because i was mighty pissed off.

for the comments on LOTR i was trying to illustrate that it is a classic, not that everyone should love it. take for instance shakespeare i'm not much of a fan, but i'm not going to go arround saying that his works are crap because he is classic, his writings are responsible for the development of the english language, and as a historical look at that time period, because of this i respect shakespeare doesn't mean that i like him though.

and now for the thing about english...

so lests say that tomorow all english speeking countries, esp thoes in north america are all of a sudden poor, no jobs to be had and the dollar is devistated. we are all in extreme poverty, lets say as well that there is a war here in north america between us and the US over what little resources we have. so we young  people are hell bent on having a good life so we move to the big economic countries. we are going to say that this is the middle east (just for fun and arguments sake). now i duno about you but i sure don't speek arabic, and most of you out there with the exception of arabs probably don't speek arabic either, ok mabey the numbers 1-10 or hello or something but not much. keep in mind that english is no longer the language of business and english speeking countries are in disreguard because of the wars here over little natural resources (barbaric i know) not to mention the US formerly being an invasive power. As an english speeker you will always be mistaken for an american even if you are not.

so we go over to...where ever lets pick Iran for fun. we are over there struggling to learn arabic and make due with what we know, because we are stupid westerners, our schooling has no creditability there because we went to inferior schools. so there we are working second rate jobs bearly scrapping by to make enough money for food and shelter.

so we are working our buts off and getting no where we have no education, we don't know the language, we are not advancing in our jobs it's hopeless. and we are being looked down uppon as english speeking americans with a horrible culture. then some random guy is walking arround and we can sorta understand what he is saying kuz we are slowly learning arabic and what we hear is :"i hate working with these damn immigrants who can't even speek arabic! they can't even learn it, they are always mixing it with english why cant thoes damn people just get it right."

 

now i'm going to throw out a classic little idea at you, teat others as you would like to be treated, how would you feel if it was you? this is why i'm so angry, it's totaly inconsiderate.

 

oh also another thing, not getting mad at you leni but, i never said that i was good at english, i know i'm a terrible speller. and i know how hard it can be to work with people that don't know english, i've worked in service as well, but you have to give them props for trying, i know if i was plunked down in some country where i knew nothing about the language that i would be screwed over.
